channel.title: Space technology of the Day
channel.description: RSS feed of the space technology of the day.

item.title: Kosmos (satellite)
item.description: Kosmos (Russian: Космос, IPA: [ˈkosməs], meaning '(outer) space') is a designation given to many satellites operated by the Soviet Union and subsequently Russia. Kosmos 1, the first spacecraft to be given a Kosmos designation, was launched on 16 March 1962.
